states.name: Queensland
states.attractions: Great Barrier Reef, Fraser Island, Whitsundays or Daintree Forest

states.name: Tasmania
states.attractions: Cradle Mountain National Park, Freycinet N. Park, Tasman N. Park or Bruny Island

states.name: Western Australia
states.attractions: Karijini National Park, Ningaloo Reef or Rottnest Island

animals.name: Koala
animals.kill: Just with a overdose of tenderness
animals.description: Koalas are well-known for their large round head, big furry ears and big black nose. Their fur is usually grey-brown in colour with white fur on the chest, inner arms, ears and bottom. They have no fur on their nose or the palms of their paws. Koalas have particularly hard bottoms, which is similar to their closest relative, the wombat. For the koala, this feature enables them to wedge comfortably in tree forks for long periods of time, whereas the wombat uses its hard bottom as a defence mechanism.

animals.name: Kangaroo
animals.kill: Roo's can kick your ass if you bother them but are inoffensive animals.
animals.description: All kangaroos have short hair, powerful hind legs, small forelimbs, big feet and a long tail. They have excellent hearing and keen eyesight. Depending on the species, their fur coat can be red, grey or light to dark brown.

animals.name: Wombat
animals.kill: Look at this cute face, unable to kill anything
animals.description: Wombats are marsupials with brown, tan or grey fur and from their stubby tails to their large skulls they can measure 1.3m long and weigh 36kg.
